result.execSummary:
The defendant Sean Patrick Balles was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 4th Degree Sexual Assault, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
*Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge
*No contact with victim
*Comply with and complete any and all counseling as recommended by the Agent
*Bond to be applied to restitution
*If probation is discharged/revoked with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due and/or other collection procedures will be implemented. If revoked and sent to prison, DOC shall withhold 25% of all inmate monies to pay fines/costs/surcharges/restitution with the balance due as a condition of extended supervision/parole.

Defendant Sean Patrick Balles in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Atty Hendee makes sentencing recommendations.
Atty Gumz makes sentencing arguments.
Defendant makes a statement to the court. 

BY THE COURT:  Withhold Sentence; 12 months Probation with conditions:
Court orders 40 days in the Marquette County Jail w/huber
  Report on or before March 5, 2018 by 7:00pm, clean & sober.
May serve in Kenosha County
Court Costs = $243.00
DNA Sample + $200.00 Surcharge
Restitution = $485.00 + $48.50 Surcharge = $533.50

bond to be applied towards restitution

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Sentencing hearing on December 7, 2017 at 10:15 am.

Defendant Sean Patrick Balles in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that this was set for trial and then resolved; however he received an email this morning.  Atty Gumz states that the defendant will plea today but requests a sentencing date.

BY THE COURT:  Court will proceed today and set sentencing.

  Atty Hendee states plea agreement.  Atty Gumz agrees.  Defendant agrees and enters a No Contest plea.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made freely, voluntarily & Intelligently.  Court relies on the criminal complaint for a factual basis.  

BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty.
Set for Sentencing
bond continued  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 7, 2017 at 10:15 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 19, 2017 at 11:45 am.

BY THE COURT:  Set for Trial

Defendant Sean Patrick Balles in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Atty Gumz files an authorization to appear with the court.
 Court confirms the defendant's address.  Atty Gumz states that the Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.  Court finds probable cause to support the charges.     Attorney request the Court enter a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.

  BY THE COURT:  Court enters a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.
